page.title: 01SUMMARY OF LOWESTOFT
page.content: LOWESTOFT is the most EASTERLY point of Great Britain. The population is about 62,000. The fishing INDUSTRY is slowly declining and a lot of the trawlers are used as standby ships for the oil rigs. It is a small seaside town busy in the summer. There is a new shopping centre where Queen Elizabeth and Prince Phillip will be visiting soon . The present shopping precinct was created when the traffic was diverted to a new one-way traffic system. The town is divided by Lake Lothing and access to either north or south Lowestoft can only be gained via either of two road bridges, one at Oulton Broad and the other in Lowestoft itself. In the summer months especially, traffic tends to build up at these bottlenecks causing much delay and inconvenience to everyone.
